description: This cocktail is a tribute to Masha P. Johnson, one of the leaders of the Stonewall uprising. The recipe calls for pouring your own shot of rum over the drink, representing one of the many things that were thrown at police that night.
headline: This Gingery Pineapple and Rum Collins Embraces the Spirit of Queer Rebellion

HowtoTip.text: Cordial: Unlike ginger syrup, which involves cooking ginger slices in simple syrup, this ginger cordial is a mix of ginger juice and sugar. The cordial has a more intense ginger flavor and isn't as sweet.

name: This Gingery Pineapple and Rum Collins Embraces the Spirit of Queer Rebellion
recipeIngredient: 1 bar spoon syrup from a jar of brandied or Luxardo cherries (about 1 teaspoon)
2 ounces club soda or sparkling mineral water

recipeInstructions.text: Coarsely chop 4 ounces unpeeled ginger (about 1 cup). Place in a blender and add 1 cup hot water. Blend on high speed until smooth, about 1 minute.
Pour through a fine-mesh strainer into a liquid measuring cup. Press on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible. Discard the contents of the strainer.

Rinse out the blender. Pour the strained ginger juice back into the blender and add 1 cup granulated sugar. Blend until the sugar is dissolved, about 1 minute more. Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.
Place 1 bar spoon brandied cherry syrup in a chilled collins or highball glass and fill the glass with ice

Juice 1 medium lime until you have 3/4 ounce. Place the lime juice, 1 ounce pineapple juice, and 3/4 ounce Ginger Syrup in a cocktail shaker. Add ice to the shaker, seal, and shake vigorously until the outside of the shaker is frosty.
Add 2 ounces club soda to the shaker and swirl to combine. Pour through a fine-mesh strainer into the glass. Top with 1 1/2 ounces Bacardi 8 Gold Rum.
